title: How The New T-Mobile's Revenue And Subscriber Metrics Stack Up Versus Rivals - Nasdaq.com
text: The merger between T-Mobile ( TMUS  ) and Sprint ( S  ) received regulatory approval in late July, with the U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) ratifying the deal. The two companies expect to close the merger by the end of 2019, creating a stronger rival to market leaders Verizon and AT&T. In this analysis, we take a look at the revenues of the combined entity (The New T-Mobile) and how its subscriber metrics stack up versus rivals.
